title: A countercuffe giuen to Martin Iunior by the ventruous, hardie, and renowned Pasquill of England caualiero ; not of olde Martins making, which newlie knighted the saints in heauen, with rise vp Sir Peter and Sir Paule, but lately dubd for his seruice at home in the defence of his countrey, and for the cleane breaking of his staffe vppon Martins face.
author: Nash, Thomas, 1567-1601.
publicationPlace: Printed, betweene the skye and the grounde, vvithin a myle of an oake and not many fieldes of [i.e. London?] :
publisher: From the vnpriuiledged presse of the assignes of Martin Junior [i.e. John Charlewood],
